Smith announced at the Wizard World Chicago 2006 convention that his next project would move in a different direction, and would be a horror film.<ref>Sciretta, Peter. August 7, 2006.</ref> In April 2007, Smith revealed the title of the movie to be ''Red State'' and said that it was inspired by pastor [[Fred Phelps]], or as Smith claimed, "very much about that subject matter, that point of view and that position taken to the absolute [[extremism|extreme]]. It's certainly not Phelps himself but it's very much inspired by a Phelps (like) figure."<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://uk.rottentomatoes.com/news/1648575/ |title=Rotten Tomatoes, RT-UK Exclusive: Kevin Smith's Horror Project Revealed |publisher=Uk.rottentomatoes.com |author=Joe Utichi | April 6, 2007 |date= |accessdate=November 9, 2008}}</ref> With the script finished, Smith originally planned to shoot the film in late March or early April 2009. In a blog update, Smith stated that [[Bob Weinstein|Bob]] and [[Harvey Weinstein]] had passed on ''Red State''.<ref name = "weinsteinpass">{{Cite web|url=http://silentbobspeaks.com/?p=359 |title=A Loooooong Update of Where Iâve Been and What Iâve Been Doing |accessdate=November 11, 2007}}</ref> The Weinsteins had thus far been involved in distribution of all Kevin Smith films, with the exceptions of ''Mallrats'' and ''Dogma''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.dreadcentral.com/news/33921/kevin-smiths-red-state-gets-funding |title=Kevin Smith's Red State Gets Funding? |publisher=Dreadcentral.com |date= |accessdate=March 15, 2010}}</ref> Speaking at a live event in London on October 13, 2009, Smith stated that funding had been secured for ''Red State'' but he was more in the mindset to proceed with ''[[Hit Somebody]]'' and hold ''Red State'' off for a year. Another reason cited was a superstition he holds around dying after his tenth movie, and not wanting to leave an "unpleasant, nasty" film as his last.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/17813 |title=Kevin Smith Gets Down and Dirty with 'Red State' Details |publisher=Bloody-disgusting.com |date= |accessdate=March 15, 2010}}</ref> In February 2010, he talked about his project with Cinssu,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://cinssu.ca/blog/?p=610 |title=Kevin Smith: Out of the Comfort Zone |publisher=Cinssu.ca |date=February 4, 2010 |accessdate=March 15, 2010}}</ref> saying that the project is currently working out financial challenges, and may even get funded through investments from his many loyal fans.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/18989 |title=Kevin Smith Asks for 'Red State' Money, Mr. Disgusting Loses It |publisher=Bloody-disgusting.com |date=February 5, 2010 |accessdate=March 15, 2010}}</ref> On March 23, 2010 it was announced that Smith would begin production of the project in July 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/19560|title=Kevin Smith Shooting 'Red State' This July?}}</ref> In July 2010, Smith stated on his Twitter that "God-willing, [[Sundance]] in Jan for RED STATE."
  +   +

Also, he recently{{when|date=January 2011}} stated that after filming ''Hit Somebody'' he plans on taking a break from directing films since he enjoys the podcasting network that he has created more.

Jones]] was also cast.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Twitter Post |url=http://twitter.com/ThatKevinSmith/status/23065492097 |date=September 5, 2010 |accessdate=September 5, 2010 }}</ref> On the September 20 edition of his podcast Hollywood Babble-on, Kevin Smith announced that John Goodman had joined the cast for ''Red State''. The wrap party was held on October 30, 2010, during which the cast and crew watched what Smith called a "fine-cut, complete with credits and some pre-mixing" version of the film.<ref>http://silentbobspeaks.com/?p=397</ref>
